channel.title: tools on Notes
channel.description: Read the latest tools on Notes

item.title: Alias for diff-so-fancy
item.description: diff-so-fancy is a tool to create cooler looking git diffs. To alias git dsf, enter these commands: git config --global alias.dsf "diff --color" git config --global pager.dsf "diff-so-fancy | less --tabs=4 -RFXS"
item.content:encoded:
diff-so-fancy is a tool to create cooler looking git diffs. To alias git dsf, enter these commands:

git config --global alias.dsf "diff --color"  
git config --global pager.dsf "diff-so-fancy | less --tabs=4 -RFXS"

item.title: How to disable default VSCode themes
item.description: To disable the default VSCode themes like Kimbie Dark, Red, Solarized etc, open the extensions tab (CTRL+Shift+X) and type @builtin. Then under Themes, click the ones you want to disable.
item.content:encoded: To disable the default VSCode themes like Kimbie Dark, Red, Solarized etc, open the extensions tab (CTRL+Shift+X) and type @builtin. Then under Themes, click the ones you want to disable.
